page.title: 09QUEEN ELIZABETH COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The park, which covers an area of 1400 acres, is situated on the South Downs four miles south of Petersfield, straddling the A3 London to Portsmouth road. It consists of Butser Hill and part of the Queen Elizabeth Forest, which used to be known as Buriton Forest, but was renamed in 1952 to commemmorate Queen Elizabeth II's Coronation.Uniquely,the park is administered jointly by the Forestry Commission and Hampshire County Council, and was opened by the Queen in 1976.There is a Park Centre which mounts informative and attractive displays.A number of park wardens or 'Countryside Interpreters' are employed who administer the park and run courses for students.A number of trails(including one connected with Halley's Comet)and guided walks are provided.
